subject: Languages
title: Latin and Greek Flood English
description: A micro-lesson that makes Latin and Greek Flood English usable.

hook.text: Renaissance scholars raided Latin and Greek for thousands of new words to sound more learned.

discovery.text: Some went overboard â€” critics called their excessive Latin borrowings 'inkhorn terms.'

twist.text: 'Revoluting,' 'obtestate,' and 'fatigate' were proposed. Only some survived.

climax.text: English tripled its vocabulary in the 1500s, becoming the most word-rich language on Earth.

punchline.text: English is a language that never says no to a new word.

quiz.question: What were 'inkhorn terms'?
options: Excessive Latin borrowings criticized as pretentious
